meanings.definition: The points on a camera or telescope where the eye is positioned to view an image.
meanings.sent1: I looked through the eyepoints of the camera to take a picture.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the eyepoints to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel tried to peek through the tiny eyepoints of the binoculars.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like the eyepoints of a telescope, focusing intently on the distant stars.
meanings.sent5: The eyepoints of the microscope revealed a hidden world of tiny organisms.

meanings.definition: The points on a map or diagram where the eye is directed to focus on specific details.
meanings.sent1: The eyepoints on the treasure map guided us to the buried chest.
meanings.sent2: She marked the important locations on the map with colorful eyepoints.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain followed the eyepoints on the old map to find the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The eyepoints on the blueprint led the architect to the crucial design elements.
meanings.sent5: His finger traced the eyepoints on the diagram, highlighting key information.
